body.p: Removes a user mapping for a foreign server.

section.title: Synopsis
section.codeblock: DROP USER MAPPING [ IF EXISTS ] { username | USER | CURRENT_USER | PUBLIC } SERVER servername

section.title: Description
section.p: DROP USER MAPPING removes an existing user mapping from a foreign server. To execute this command, the current user must be the owner of the server containing the mapping.

pd.p: Do not throw an error if the user mapping does not exist. Greenplum Database issues a notice in this case.
User name of the mapping. CURRENT_USER and USER match the name of the current user. PUBLIC is used to match all present and future user names in the system.
Server name of the user mapping.

section.title: Examples
section.p: Drop the user mapping named bob, server foo if it exists:
section.codeblock: DROP USER MAPPING IF EXISTS FOR bob SERVER foo;

section.title: Compatibility
section.p: DROP SERVER conforms to ISO/IEC 9075-9 (SQL/MED). The IF EXISTS clause is a Greenplum Database extension.

section.title: See Also
section.p: CREATE USER MAPPING, ALTER USER MAPPING
